as i found out, you've got a DVB-T card, so that's digital.. http://www.fedoraforum.org/forum/archive/index.php/t-97613.html might be an interesting read for you
what do i have to do? didn't understood :s

the card is already halfinstalled, it's just that due to a design flaw the card isn't auto-configurable in Linux, so you need to tell the driver, which card it is. Then you get a device in /dev/dvb/adapter0 and can use kaffeine, vlc or gxine to watch TV... kaffeine is prolly easiest, because it can scan the channels automatically
